rules.name: Introduction
rules.description: Kill Team is a tactical combat miniatures game set in the 41st Millennium where two rival teams of operatives battle to complete objectives.

rules.name: Game Structure
rules.description: A battle typically lasts four turning points, each consisting of a Strategy phase and a Firefight phase.

rules.name: Requirements
rules.description: Players need a kill team of Citadel miniatures, free online rules, a 30"x22" game board, terrain, measuring device, 10 D6 dice, and tokens.

rules.name: Deployment
rules.description: Determine initiative randomly. The player with initiative selects a drop zone (within 3" of their edge). Players alternate setting up one third of their team at a time.

rules.name: Initial Orders
rules.description: When an operative is set up, it must be wholly within its drop zone and given a Conceal order.

rules.name: Initiative
rules.description: Players roll one D6; the highest roll decides who has initiative. On a tie, the player who currently lacks initiative decides.

rules.name: Command Points (CP)
rules.description: Players start with 2CP. In the first Strategy phase, both gain 1CP. In subsequent phases, the player with initiative gains 1CP while the other gains 2CP.

rules.name: Strategic Gambits
rules.description: Players alternate using a Strategic Gambit (which includes strategy ploys) or passing. Each gambit can only be used once per turning point and costs 1CP.

rules.name: Activation
rules.description: Players alternate activating ready friendly operatives. Upon activation, select an Engage or Conceal order.

rules.name: Action Points (APL)
rules.description: Operatives perform actions costing AP. Total AP spent cannot exceed the operative's APL stat.

rules.name: Counteract
rules.description: If all your operatives are expended but your opponent's are not, one expended friendly operative with an Engage order can perform a 1AP action for free (max move 2").

rules.name: Reposition (1AP)
rules.description: Move the operative up to its Move stat. Cannot move within control range of enemies.

rules.name: Dash (1AP)
rules.description: Move up to 3". Cannot climb or move within enemy control range.

rules.name: Charge (1AP)
rules.description: Move up to Move stat + 2". Can move within and must finish in enemy control range.

rules.name: Fall Back (2AP)
rules.description: Move like a Reposition; can move within enemy control range but cannot finish there.

rules.name: Shoot (1AP)
rules.description: Perform a ranged attack. Cannot be done with a Conceal order or within enemy control range.

rules.name: Fight (1AP)
rules.description: Perform a melee attack against an enemy within control range.

rules.name: Shooting Sequence
rules.description: 1. Select weapon. 2. Select valid target. 3. Roll attack dice. 4. Defender rolls 3 defense dice (can retain 1 for cover). 5. Block successes. 6. Inflict damage.

rules.name: Fighting Sequence
rules.description: 1. Select target in control range. 2. Both select melee weapons. 3. Both roll attack dice. 4. Alternate resolving dice by striking or blocking.

rules.name: Success Types
rules.description: Rolling a 6 is a critical success. Results meeting or beating the Hit/Save stat are normal successes. Rolling a 1 is always a fail.

rules.name: Control Range
rules.description: Visible targets within 1" are in control range. This range is mutual.

rules.name: Cover
rules.description: An operative is in cover if there is intervening terrain within its control range, unless it is within 2" of the attacker.

rules.name: Damage and Injuries
rules.description: Wounded operatives have fewer than starting wounds. Injured operatives (fewer than half wounds) subtract 2" from Move and worsen Hit stats by 1.
